title: Amid opt-out rumors, Sam Kennedy says Alex Bregman ‘wants to be here’ with Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Sam Kennedy confirms Alex Bregman wants to stay with the Red Sox despite opt-out rumors.
Bregman's contract allows opt-outs after 2025 and 2026, potentially leading to free agency.
Bregman is batting .279 with 16 home runs and 57 RBIs despite a hamstring injury this season.

title: Bill Belichick says in new book that Tom Brady made ‘right decision’ to leave Patriots in 2020
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: In Gary Myers' book, Bill Belichick supports Tom Brady's decision to leave the Patriots after the 2019 season.
Belichick admits the Patriots couldn't provide Brady with a competitive team, citing financial constraints and a roster rebuild.
Brady's departure marked the end of an era, with Belichick going 29-38 and missing playoffs three out of four seasons.

title: West Boylston town administrator fired after Trump flag dispute sues town
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: James Ryan sues West Boylston for wrongful termination, seeking over $1.3 million in damages after being fired as town administrator.
Ryan was dismissed after a dispute with Police Chief Dennis Minnich over a Trump flag in a police department gym.
Ryan claims his firing was retaliation for enforcing ethics laws prohibiting political displays on public buildings.

title: 18-year-old injured in R.I. after lighting himself on fire for TikTok challenge
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: An 18-year-old in North Smithfield, R.I., suffered severe burns from a TikTok challenge involving fire and gasoline.
The man, accompanied by a 16-year-old, set himself on fire and jumped off a railroad trestle into a reservoir.
The injured man was hospitalized with second- and third-degree burns; no charges filed for trespassing on the private property.

title: ‘Fear and uncertainty’: Everett officials cancel Hispanic Heritage Month festival amid ICE crackdown
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Everett's Fiesta Del Rio festival, scheduled for September 20, was canceled due to local ICE raids causing community concern.
Mayor Carlo DeMaria cited fear and uncertainty among residents as reasons for canceling the Hispanic Heritage Month event.
The event, celebrating Hispanic culture, was to feature local music, art, and food but faced safety concerns.

title: Josh Kraft ends mayoral campaign after coming in second by nearly 50 points in Tuesday’s preliminary
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Josh Kraft ends his Boston mayoral campaign after losing the preliminary election to Mayor Michelle Wu by nearly 50 points.
Kraft raised $6.8 million for his campaign, surpassing Wu's $1.8 million, including a $3.5 million personal contribution.
Kraft plans to donate $3 million to address the humanitarian crisis near Massachusetts Avenue and Melnea Cass Boulevard.

title: Josh McDaniels defends Drake Maye: ‘He’s the right guy’ for Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Josh McDaniels defends QB Drake Maye after Patriots' Week 1 loss to the Raiders.
Maye completed 14 of 20 passes in the first half but struggled with a key interception.
McDaniels emphasizes Maye's need for experience and confidence in long-term potential despite early struggles.

title: Authorities in a Connecticut town want to speak with whoever is painting the squirrels
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Two squirrels were found painted red and blue in East Hartford near Naubuc Avenue and High Street.
East Hartford Animal Control is collaborating with a wildlife rehabilitator to decide on aid for the colored squirrels.
Authorities request anyone with information on the painting of the squirrels to call 860-291-7572.

title: 2 Mass. teachers reportedly on leave for reactions to Charlie Kirk’s death
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Two Massachusetts teachers are on leave after controversial social media posts about Charlie Kirk's shooting death.
A Wachusett teacher's Instagram post drew over two million views, and police ensured safety at the school.
Framingham Public Schools placed a teacher on leave for a video tribute to Kirk's death, with police monitoring resources.

title: A top return from Bruins’ roster teardown, prospect Fraser Minten is looking to stick in NHL
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Fraser Minten, a 21-year-old center, was acquired by the Bruins as part of a rebuilding effort after a roster teardown.
Minten aims to secure an NHL roster spot with Boston after playing 25 games in the league between Toronto and Boston.
Minten will participate in the 2025 Prospects Challenge, highlighted for his leadership and versatile skill set on the ice.
